figures.title: Lung Tissue Analysis and Cell Function Studies
figures.description: This is a multi-panel figure combining fluorescence microscopy images and functional data graphs. Panel A shows control lung tissue with immunofluorescence staining at different magnifications, while Panel B displays control human pulmonary endothelial cells (hPECs) and pulmonary artery smooth muscle cells (hPASMCs). Panels C-I present various functional assays including SOCE protocol measurements, histamine stimulation responses, and quantitative analyses of cellular parameters like proliferation rates and wound closure. The data shows comparative results across different treatment groups (siControl, siTRPC1, siTRPC3, siTRPC4, siTRPC6) with statistical significance indicators.
figures.caption: Fig. 1 (See legend on next page)

figures.title: TRPC Protein Expression in PAH Lung Tissue
figures.description: This figure consists of two parts: (A) immunofluorescence microscopy images showing the localization of TRPC1, TRPC3, TRPC4, and TRPC6 proteins (red) with vWF endothelial marker (yellow) and nuclei (blue) in PAH patient lung sections, and (B) Western blot analysis with quantification comparing TRPC protein expression levels between control and PAH human pulmonary endothelial cells (hPECs). The immunofluorescence reveals co-localization of TRPC proteins with endothelial markers in pulmonary vessels, while the Western blot data shows significantly increased expression of TRPC1 and TRPC6 in PAH compared to control cells. This demonstrates altered calcium channel protein expression in pulmonary arterial hypertension.
figures.caption: Comparison of TRPC localization and expression in control-hPECs and PAH-hPECs. A Expression and localization of TRPC1, TRPC3, TRPC4, and TRPC6 by immunofluorescence staining of paraffin-embedded lung sections from PAH patients. TRPC proteins are in red, vWF in yellow, and endothelial cell nuclei are in blue (DAPI). Right column: magnitude X5 with white arrows to highlight co-staining TRPC with vWF. B Immunoblot images and quantification of TRPC1, TRPC3, and TRPC6 protein expression in hPECs from control and PAH patients (TRPC1: n = 10 control and PAH patients; TRPC3 and TRPC6: n = 5 control and PAH patients; TRPC4: n = 8 control and PAH patients). ns = non-significant; * P < 0.05, **P < 0.01

figures.title: Calcium Influx Comparison in PAH vs Control Cells
figures.description: This is a multi-panel figure containing time-course graphs and bar charts comparing calcium influx mechanisms between control and PAH (pulmonary arterial hypertension) human pulmonary endothelial cells. The figure presents two experimental protocols: SOCE (store-operated calcium entry) using thapsigargin stimulation and histamine-induced calcium influx, measured by 340/380 fluorescence ratios. The key finding shows that while SOCE responses are similar between control and PAH cells (panels A-C show no significant differences), histamine-induced calcium influx is significantly reduced in PAH cells compared to controls (panels D-E, with PAH showing lower area under the curve).
figures.caption: Comparison of SOCE and histamine-calcium influx in control and PAH-hPECs. A Illustrations of the 340/380 ratio in SOCE protocol mediated by Thapsigargin (Tg) in control and PAH-hPECs. B Quantifications of Tg influx by calculating delta peak Tg in control and PAH-(n = 3 for control and 4 for PAH patients). C Quantifications of SOCE influx by calculating delta peak SOCE in control and PAH-hPECs (n = 6 for control and 8 for PAH patients). D Illustrations of the 340/380 ratio in histamine-induced Ca²⁺ influx in control and PAH-hPECs. E Quantifications of histamine-induced Ca²⁺ influx by calculating the area under the curve for control and PAH-hPECs (n = 5 for control and 4 for PAH patients). ns = non significant; * P < 0.05

figures.title: TRPC Channel Knockdown Effects on Calcium Signaling
figures.description: This figure consists of multiple panels showing calcium signaling experiments in PAH-hPECs with different TRPC channel knockdowns. Panels A and D show time-course traces of calcium ratio measurements using SOCE protocol and histamine stimulation respectively, while panels B, C, and E present quantitative bar charts of the corresponding calcium responses. The data demonstrates that knockdown of different TRPC channels (TRPC1, TRPC3, TRPC4, TRPC6) has varying effects on ER calcium release, SOCE influx, and histamine-induced calcium influx compared to siControl, with statistical significance indicated by asterisks and 'ns' for non-significant differences.
figures.caption: Consequences of TRPC channels knockdown in PAH-hPECs. A Illustrations of the 340/380 ratio in SOCE protocol mediated by Thapsigargin (Tg) in siControl, siTRPC1, siTRPC3, siTRPC4, and siTRPC6 conditions. B Quantifications of ER Ca²⁺ release by calculating delta peak Tg under siControl, siTRPC1, siTRPC3, siTRPC4, and siTRPC6 conditions (n = 13 for siControl, 8 for siTRPC1, siTRPC4 and siTRPC6, 9 for siTRPC3). C Quantifications of the mean SOCE influx by calculating delta peak SOCE in siControl, siTRPC1, siTRPC3, siTRPC4, and siTRPC6 conditions (n = 12 patients for siControl, 8 for siTRPC1, 9 for siTRPC3, 8 for siTRPC4, and 8 for siTRPC6). D Illustrations of the 340/380 ratio in histamine-induced Ca²⁺ influx in siControl, siTRPC1, siTRPC3, siTRPC4, and siTRPC6 conditions. E Quantifications of the mean histamine-induced Ca²⁺ influx by calculating the area under the curve for siControl, siTRPC1, siTRPC3, siTRPC4,

figures.title: TRPC Channel Knockdown Effects on PAH Cell Functions
figures.description: This is a multi-panel experimental figure showing bar charts and microscopy images that analyze the effects of knocking down different TRPC channels (TRPC1, TRPC3, TRPC4, TRPC6) on pulmonary arterial hypertension human pulmonary endothelial cells (PAH-hPECs). The figure presents data on wound closure/migration (Panel A), angiogenesis through tube formation assays (Panel B), cell proliferation rates (Panel C), and cell proliferation in a crosstalk experiment (Panel D). The results show that TRPC1 and TRPC3 knockdown significantly impair cell migration and proliferation, while TRPC4 and TRPC6 knockdown have less pronounced effects, suggesting differential roles of these calcium channels in PAH pathophysiology.
figures.caption: Consequences of TRPC1, TRPC3, TRPC4, and TRPC6 knockdown on migration and angiogenesis in PAH-hPECs. A (Illustration of siControl and siTRPC6) Wound closure normalized by siControl in siTRPC1, siTRPC3, siTRPC4, and TRPC6 conditions; bar length = 750 μm; right: quantifications (n = 5 patients for siTRPC1 and siTRPC4 and n = 4 patients for siTRPC3 and siTRPC6). B Angiogenesis by tube formation assay; left: illustrations; right: quantifications of segment length and number of junctions normalized by siControl in siTRPC1, siTRPC3, siTRPC4, and TRPC6 conditions (n = 4 patients for siTRPC1, siTRPC3, and siTRPC4 and n = 5 patients for siTRPC6). C Proliferation rate normalized by siControl for siTRPC1, siTRPC3, siTRPC4, and siTRPC6 conditions measured by BrdU incorporation (n = 6 patients for siTRPC1 and siTRPC3 and n = 4 for siTRPC4 and siTRPC6). D The proliferation of

figures.title: TRPC Knockdown Effects on Endothelial Dysfunction Genes
figures.description: This figure consists of multiple bar charts showing mRNA expression levels of various genes involved in endothelial cell dysfunction in PAH-hPECs (pulmonary arterial hypertension human pulmonary endothelial cells). Panel A demonstrates the effects of TRPC1 knockdown on multiple genes including CD40, IL1β, TNF, PTGFR, ANGPT1, LCP, IRF3, PPARGC1A, EDNRA, and AGTR1, with most showing significant upregulation compared to control. Panels B and C show the effects of TRPC3 knockdown on CD40 (increased expression) and TRPC4 knockdown on HDAC5 (decreased expression), respectively. The results indicate that knockdown of different TRPC channels leads to distinct patterns of gene expression changes related to endothelial dysfunction.
figures.caption: Fig. 6 Consequences of TRPC1, TRPC3, and TRPC4 knockdown by siRNA on mRNA expression of genes involved in endothelial cell dysfunction in PAH-hPECs. A mRNA expression of CD40 after TRPC1 knockdown (n = 4 patients). B mRNA expression of CD40 after TRPC3 knockdown (n = 4 patients). C mRNA expression of HDAC5 after TRPC4 knockdown (n = 5 patients). ns = non significant; * P < 0.05; **P < 0.01
